SENT.plain: Among 50 previously well patients, aged 69 years or older, who had a first seizure, a cause could be identified in only 25 (50%)
Cerebrovascular disease accounted for the seizures in 30% of the total group
In 25 patients (50%), a cause could not be identified
A total of 56% of the patients had focal motor seizures, and in 44%, the seizures were generalized
A definite cause could be established in 57% of those with focal seizure and in 41% of those with generalized seizures
These results are compared with previous surveys of adult-onset epilepsy and indicate a somewhat different etiologic distribution in elderly patients
